definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The temperature of cold-blooded animals change with the temperature of the surroundings .
sentences.chinese: 冷血動物的體溫隨着周圍的環境的改變而變化。

sentences.english: The turtle, like all reptiles, is cold-blooded.
sentences.chinese: 海龜和所有爬行動物一樣，是冷血動物。

sentences.english: Fox called me beautiful wood usually pimple, cold-blooded .
sentences.chinese: 狐美人常常罵我木頭疙瘩，冷血動物。

sentences.english: Some cold-blooded animals sleep all through the winter.
sentences.chinese: 一些冷血動物整個冬天都在睡覺。
他們是冷血動物，像蛇一樣。

sentences.english: Cold- blooded animals, such as snakes and frogs, hibernate in winter.
sentences.chinese: 冷血動物，例如蛇和青蛙，冬季要冬眠。

definition: please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3

definition: strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
partner for dating/a date (boyfriend or girlfriend)
